content.title: 1911 UK Census: New Details Revealed
content.teaser: The 1911 census includes unprecedented detail about occupations, room counts, and even fertility information. Discover what makes this census unique for English research.

content.title: German Church Records: Your Key to Pre-1800s Ancestry
content.teaser: Before civil registration began, German church records were the primary documentation of births, marriages, and deaths. Learn how to navigate these critical records.

content.title: Ellis Island: Gateway to America
content.teaser: Between 1892 and 1954, over 12 million immigrants entered the United States through Ellis Island. Learn how to find your ancestors in passenger lists and what information they contain.

content.title: Life in Welsh Mining Communities: 1850-1920
content.teaser: Coal mining shaped Welsh culture and communities for generations. Discover the records that document miners' lives, from employment registers to accident reports.

content.title: DNA Testing 101: What Your Results Can Tell You
content.teaser: Thinking about taking a DNA test? Learn what ethnicity estimates, DNA matches, and genetic traits can reveal about your family history.

content.title: Maximizing Your DNA Matches: Advanced Strategies
content.teaser: You have your DNA resultsâ€”now what? Learn how to contact matches effectively, build shared ancestor trees, and break through brick walls with genetic genealogy.

content.title: 5 Tips for Building Your First Family Tree
content.teaser: Starting your genealogy journey? Learn the essential strategies that will help you build a strong foundation and avoid common beginner mistakes.

content.title: Advanced Research: Using Cluster Genealogy
content.teaser: Stuck on a brick wall? Learn how researching your ancestor's neighbors, friends, and associates can unlock clues about your direct line.

content.title: WWI Draft Registration Cards: Every Man Aged 18-45
content.teaser: Nearly 24 million American men registered for WWI draft between 1917-1918. These cards contain physical descriptions, occupations, and family details.

content.title: Hidden Gems in Historical Newspapers
content.teaser: Beyond obituaries: discover birth announcements, society pages, employment ads, and court proceedings that bring your ancestors' lives to light.

thisWeekInHistory.description: President Grover Cleveland dedicated the Statue of Liberty in New York Harbor. Was your ancestor there to witness it?
The Great Depression began with the stock market crash. How did this event affect your family?
